description: The round payoff this round was 118. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 59.

The game resembles a stag hunt scenario where mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields higher payoffs but requires trust, while mutual defection (both choosing option 2) is a safer but lower-payoff equilibrium

The existence of two Nash equilibria (both choosing 1 or both choosing 2) highlights the need for coordination to achieve the optimal outcome, emphasizing the role of trust and established patterns of cooperation

The payoff structure incentivizes players to align their strategies: unilateral defection (choosing 2) risks a worse outcome for both, reinforcing the importance of consistent, cooperative behavior over multiple rounds
